TopicTitle: I finally watched Frozen... I wish I had done so earlier!

Articles.Content: Well, I watched Frozen, and wished I had watched it earlier. I used to hate it, but then I watched Let It Go. That alone made me like it.

The same could be said for me and Citizen Kane. The introductory sequence is just plain stunning, what with the lit window of the Xanadu being in the exact same place in the frame in every single scene and the almost undiscernable switch from outside Kane's window to inside his bedroom.
eh, you don't need to see frozen. just watch this:

My opinion is that "Let it Go" is the only good thing about Frozen. It is an ok song, but everything else does not compare to other Disney films. The plot was way too simple and had so many unexplained events, the characters were cliche, and the ending way so forced into being happy. I don't even know what the message of the story is! Movies that I like such as How to Train Your Dragon 2, Interstellar, and Mockingjay Part 1, are intricate and thought-provoking. Now, keep in mind that is MY opinion, and does not reflect or judge anyone else's.

The plot was way too simple and had so many unexplained events, the characters were cliche, and the ending way so forced into being happy.

So Frozen was a lot like Gravity then?
I'll just leave this right here....
Frozen is a great kids show, with enough jokes for adults that they are entertained, too. Olaf is hilarious.

Frozen was an okay movie, the songs weren't that bad.

Then people spammed Let It Go all over the internet and I died

Frozen is a great kids show, with enough jokes for adults that they are entertained, too. Olaf is hilarious.

I'll just leave my two cents about Olaf.

When he started melting, I was like "YES!" but then "NO!".

Frozen 2 is coming out.

(source)

While Frozen wasn't bad, it did not deserve the hype surrounding it, nor did it deserve the popularity...

...and now, Disney has once again proven that profits are far more important than doing pathetic things like making good original content. I should have lost all respect for Disney a long, long time ago, and yet some shred of it remains. Maybe this is because I really liked the classic Disney videos as a kid...

I'm going to go yell at the universe now. Be back in a bit.

The plot was way too simple and had so many unexplained events

Yeah... I keep waiting for that two-hour deleted scene with the science journal about how Elsa casts ice power

Frozen 2 is coming out.

were all going to die.

Frozen 2 is coming out.

I'M LEAVING THIS UNIVERSE AND GOING TO LIVE WITH THE KERBALS ON LAYTHE. BYE!

Seriously, WHY?! Frozen came out in February...now it's nearly December! Everyone just stop freaking out about it! It's a cash-grab through and through, and it is mind-blowing how Disney, once one of the most respectable movie producers in the industry, has come this low (a sequel to a movie that wasn't even that good?!) just to make some quick money! AGH!

/ragemode
Disney makes cheap sequels to ANYTHING that sells even moderately well. This is nothing new.

Hype Aversion is why I haven't seen Frozen yet.

(warning: TVTropes might be a huge timesink for you.)

that is actually any film company at some point

Frozen 2 is coming out.

...

Well, I'll be in my bunker if you need me.

...

Well, I'll be in my bunker if you need me.

Has it never occurred to anyone that the apocalypse is actually happening right now?

The masses are just getting stupider and stupider, you could even call them farm animals instead of "consumers". Nowadays all cash grabs and awful products sell well, because people are buying stuff because of "peer-pressure" or just because they are too stupid to realize that they are buying a overpriced cash grab. Take beats headphones for example. They are severely overpriced for their sound quality, yet people buy them just so they can be "cool" or "popular".

Edited November 30, 2014 by Kinglet
I must be the only one around here that would like to see Frozen 2.

I must be the only one around here that would like to see Frozen 2.

I would, but I don't trust Disney when it comes to sequels to their cartoons. The only thing giving me more hope for this one is they're already working on it, so there's a good chance they can bring the same team back together. But that still doesn't guarantee it will hold a candle to the original.

I jump at the chance to know Elsa better though. There really wasn't much time to develop her character because she spent most of her time wrestling with what she is. After getting over that hurdle, she still doesn't know WHO she is.
